ccre.workarounds

Class ThrowablePrinter

  • java.lang.Object
    • ccre.workarounds.ThrowablePrinter

  • public abstract class ThrowablePrinter
extends java.lang.Object
    A provider that can print out a Throwable to a given PrintStream. This is only needed because Squawk doesn't have a Throwable.printStackTrace(PrintStream) method, so a different provider is needed for Squawk. Also provides getMethodCaller(int) because that's a similar idea.
    Author:
    skeggsc

    • Method Detail

      • initProvider

        public static void initProvider()
        Ensure that there is an available provider. At least, there will be a fake throwable printer that can't actually print the exception traceback.

      • printThrowable

        public static void printThrowable(java.lang.Throwable thr,
                  java.io.PrintStream pstr)
        Print the specified Throwable to the specified PrintStream.
        Parameters:
        thr - the throwable to print.
        pstr - the PrintStream to write to.

      • toStringThrowable

        public static java.lang.String toStringThrowable(java.lang.Throwable thr)
        Convert the specified Throwable to a String that contains what would have been printed by printThrowable. Printing this value is equivalent to just calling printThrowable originally.
        Parameters:
        thr - the throwable to print.
        Returns:
        the String version of the throwable, including the traceback.

      • getMethodCaller

        public static CallerInfo getMethodCaller(int index)
        Get diagnostic information for someone in the call stack of this method, at a given index. Index 0 is the caller of this method; 1 is the caller of that method, etc. This should contain, at the very least, the class, but should also contain the method, source file, and line number if possible.
        Parameters:
        index - which frame to report.
        Returns:
        a CallerInfo for the specified caller, or null.

      • findMethodCaller

        public abstract CallerInfo findMethodCaller(int index)
        Get diagnostic information for someone in the call stack of this method, at a given index. Index 0 is the caller of this method; 1 is the caller of that method, etc. This should contain, at the very least, the class, but should also contain the method, source file, and line number if possible.
        Parameters:
        index - which frame to report.
        Returns:
        a CallerInfo for the specified caller, or null.

      • send

        public abstract void send(java.lang.Throwable thr,
        java.io.PrintStream pstr)
        Send the specified Throwable to the specified PrintStream.
        Parameters:
        thr - the throwable
        pstr - the PrintStream.
